main event: On October 7, 1958, in Grand Rapids, Michigan, 24 objects the size of a dime were observed traveling at high altitude in two flights of 12 each for 6-8 seconds. An astronomer studying Mars suggested that the objects were likely part of an interesting shower.
interesting points: The sighting involved 24 objects, each the size of a dime, traveling at high altitude in two flights of 12 each for 6-8 seconds.
An astronomer studying Mars provided an opinion that the objects were probably part of an interesting shower due to their distribution.
The objects were observed flying very high and in a southeasterly direction.
No photographs were included in the report.
There was a request to contact the source of the report for further information and to evaluate the activity of the observed objects.
sighted object: 24 objects, each the size of a dime
